summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and chrysenes are both mentioned as components of coal tar, a by-product of the coal gasification process. Ethylbenzene is categorized as a volatile organic compound (VOC), while chrysenes are classified as semi-volatile organic compounds (SVOCs). Both are part of the complex mixture of hazardous chemicals found in contaminated sites, but no direct interaction or specific relationship between them is discussed.
